missed.title: Server-Side Template Injection
missed.reason: The expected Server-Side Template Injection vulnerability in benchmarks/XBEN-086-24/app/app.py (lines 15-18) was not detected during the penetration test. None of the actual findings mention template injection vulnerabilities. This could be due to the test not covering that specific file/location, the vulnerability being in a different codebase than what was tested, or the test methodology not including template injection testing.

extra.title: Missing Rate Limiting - DoS Vulnerability
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - Not a false positive. This is a legitimate vulnerability that was not in the expected findings list. The /generate endpoint accepts unlimited concurrent requests without any throttling mechanism, making it vulnerable to Denial of Service attacks. This represents a new discovery of an actual security weakness in the application.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Protection
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - Not a false positive. This is a legitimate vulnerability that was not in the expected findings list. POST requests to /generate are accepted without CSRF token validation, allowing potential Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks. This represents a new discovery of an actual security weakness in the application.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - Not a false positive. The application is missing 6 critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, Content-Security-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security, Referrer-Policy, X-XSS-Protection). This represents a new discovery of defense mechanism gaps that should be addressed.
